reviewText:
Looks like a tech demo (look at our fabulous floating cubes).

There's no tutorial, no manual. Every game mode pops you on a rectangular layer of blocks that are then hit by red blocks from above that damage and deform the layer. You have two powers, one restores the layer and replenishes with time (or not, in hard mode) and another that I haven't figured out at all (slow motion, sort of). You get scored on how long you manage not to fall as the platform crumbles around you. That is all there is to this game - well, there's a beta builder where you make non-rectangular layers. Whoop-de-doo.

It's annoying me because it is one of those first person 3D platformers where you can't see your feet, yet would wish to land on cubes precisely.

I see nothing here that makes me want to play this.

Note that there won't be any further updates as of January 11th since the devs had a hard drive crash and no backups. Serves them right.

reviewText:
This game is loads of fun with a simple objective.. Stay alive as long as possible before you end up falling through outer space for eternity!  Yikes!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eyR0I50rAn0

The world in comprised of nice looking reflective blocks and the outer space all around you is simply gorgeous.

Add in a very funky, fun, and fast paced musical background and you are ready for your attempt at surivivng as long as possible.  To beat your friends score, every second of surviving here is vital!  Where do you step?  Do you risk jumping the crumbling blocks to get to the other side where it looks safer and were you might live another 30 seconds?

This game offers two modes: Platform and Dash.  Platform is a big square area that is crumbling as red blocks smash into it from above.  In platform, every second you survive adds another point.  Dash offers a narrow, long base that you run back and forth on always trying to grab the blue score balls that will increase your score.  In each mode, the left mouse button will do some repair to blocks as they are falling apart, but once they have formed a hole, it's too late.  Each mode also offers three difficulty levels to make sure you are always challenged.  Other then that, the objective is to simply score as many points before you fal to your death!

My score for this game based on my personal scoring system is an 81%  Watch the above provided video to see how I came up with my score if you are interested.

Definite thumbs up especially for family get togethers and parties!  Certain to provide lots of laughs and draw interest as you play it!

BONUS VIDEO!  Watch my 10 year old son try to beat his dad (me) at this game:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w0CRD0dzbWo

reviewText:
I kinda like the game,but ,it's missing a lot of options.
For start I can't play without the Y axis inverted.
I have a old pc ( Q9300 / 6GB DDR2 / HD 6670 ) and the game runs like a turtle, even when i put it to 800 * 600 on fastest windowed mode.

Some recommendations :
- add more options to mouse
- improve game optimization"
- level editor

I can't talk about the price because I won it on a contest :P

So my score at this stage of the game 5/10 .
Still funny to play but need improvements :)"

This game is great but it need more features! Add levels that increase in difficulty/look different or add something to WORK FOR. I would certainly recommend this gem to anyone, but there are a few UI problems and the game has no real goal unless you are a fan of high scoring arcade games. Excellent idea, just feels like its missing something.

It looks decent and the background music track is alright. The concept is interesting but there is barerly any content in the game. I expected actual maps or challenges but what you get is a rectangle that falls apart. It is my understanding that this has been in early access and considering that there really should be more content in the game.

If you do not believe me then filter out all the thumbs down reviews and only look at the thumbs up reviews. 7/13 positive reviews that i can see (english ones) have only played up to half an hour. 3/13 have played more than 2 hours.

I can see how the game could be interesting in early access the content they currently have is not worth the price in my opinion.
Great game, love the strategy and the physics. great game you made BUT there are pros and cons about this.\nif you think about buying this then think about it, i say its a great game.\n

Pretty simple and intuitive and it can even pass as an educational game of sorts.

The objective is parkouring your way from point to point without falling into the abyss of deep space.  Aside from the ability to sprint huge distances you have a reality warping" ability of sorts where you can temporarily "repair" the road and prevent it from breaking apart.

Now only if they could make the tiles brighter as sometimes it's difficult to see them.  I suppose it's meant to be that way to train ones' alertness and eyesight."
AMAZING CONCEPT, love it. It just really needs more levels and feature. It can go a very long way with more features.

This game has potential, especially if some sort of speed run is implimented, or enemies or something that just mixes up the gameplay. By the way, it's super easy to get a high score, simply go on builder, place one block and start.

This is a pretty good game. There are a few bugs, but they don't make much of a difference to the actual gameplay. There isn't too much to do at the moment, but the whole idea is great. I haven't played the game very much, but it's a really great game to play if you're bored or want to play something quick. Also, the soundtrack is badass :P\n\n9/10

Honestly not that bad, framerate issues with a quality pc. Dash mode is broken at the moment but I hope it gets fixed soon. Some pretty cool mechanics, Being able to partly rebuild the damage on the platform ater being destroyed. Sprinting is pretty meh, doesn't feel like a direct speed boost. Platform mode is probably the best in my opinion, because it gives you a large platform to run on, and that means more micro-managing because there are more areas to rebuild after being destroyed. There are some pretty weird aspects with say, lighting. The number one thing is how your body and cubes are for the most part the same color. I would like to see a distinct costume or soemthing along those lines that the character wears, and the blocks to be a brighter color.  Overall a pretty good timekiller. You really can't go wrong with this game.
A simple physics demo with an ear-grating soundtrack, nothing more. Pretty to look at for a few minutes, nothing more to it.

This game has potential, especially if some sort of speed run is implimented, or enemies or something that just mixes up the gameplay. By the way, it's super easy to get a high score, simply go on builder, place one block and start.

It looks decent and the background music track is alright. The concept is interesting but there is barerly any content in the game. I expected actual maps or challenges but what you get is a rectangle that falls apart. It is my understanding that this has been in early access and considering that there really should be more content in the game.

If you do not believe me then filter out all the thumbs down reviews and only look at the thumbs up reviews. 7/13 positive reviews that i can see (english ones) have only played up to half an hour. 3/13 have played more than 2 hours.

I can see how the game could be interesting in early access the content they currently have is not worth the price in my opinion.

Here are some pros and cons-

Pros
Epic graphics
Nice gameplay
A little suspensful
Under priced for what it is
Super fun


Cons
A little buggy when it comes to you seeing your arms and legs




9.2/10 Reccomended
